title: UnitedNot
author: UnitedNot
content: Hi everyone,I need a some advice about which Tron wallet you would recommend for mobile phones? What have you personally used that you can say works well?I have read that some wallets just dont work well and people have problems sending their coins out. Transactions are failing from time to time or users lose their tokens completely. What should I use?

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: I've been using two wallets for TRON, this Trust Wallet and Atomic Wallet for a few years now. Pretty good for exchanging and storing TRX. Although, if you need a TRON wallet to connect to some services that support this network, it's better to use native TRON wallets, like TronLink.

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: Quote from: UnitedNot on January 07, 2023, 06:21:23 PMWhat should I use? Have you tried Trust wallet? Its trusted by a lot of users and I can say that it works perfectly for me. If for storing try also to have a hard wallet, but for trading purposes you can also try to download the apps of exchanges where you can get TRX easily, Binance mobile app for example. With regards to losing your tokens, I guess this will depend on the security of the wallet you are choosing, that’s why Trust wallet is a good option for this.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: UnitedNot on January 07, 2023, 06:21:23 PMI have read that some wallets just dont work well and people have problems sending their coins out. Transactions are failing from time to time or users lose their tokens completely. What should I use? The ones I use are Exodus and TrustwalletThe reason transactions fail mostly is because the is no Tron in the address to facilate the transaction or because the address is not yet activated (allocated energy and bandwidth by staking some small amount of Tron. Some software wallets can help do this for you automatically when creating or generating a Tron address)

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: I dont know much about tron supported wallets but I only used trustwallet when using tron and never failed me to do some transactions. Got chance to use imtoken too but I think only once, also got good grief on using tron blockchain. But there are lots of new wallets I think. But based on experience, I could only recommend trustwallet for smooth transaction.

comments.author: posi
comments.body: Quote from: UnitedNot on January 07, 2023, 06:21:23 PMHi everyone,I need a some advice about which Tron wallet you would recommend for mobile phones? What have you personally used that you can say works well?I have read that some wallets just dont work well and people have problems sending their coins out. Transactions are failing from time to time or users lose their tokens completely. What should I use? To use for altcoins, I think trust wallet is the wallet to go for because it's easy to use and so far safe without problems. Regarding the problems you are mentioning, I think it's the user's fault, not the wallet's. There are many wallets for us to select, but many wallets have difficult-to-use interfaces and cumbersome operations, so users can easily get confused, leading to wrong sending and losing money...As a newbie, don't try to use too many wallets but just use Trustwallet, I really find it very easy to use for newbies.

comments.author: coinerer
comments.body: Multi wallet from trust wallet is enough for TRC-20 USDT. I am using it on the other hand you can use atomic wallet but Trust wallet is by far the most popular and useful wallet for mobile device. Since trust wallet is a non-custodial wallet, it has a security phrase, so keeping your funds here is completely under your control. So in my opinion you can choose trust wallet for mobile device to keep your USDT

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Most of wallets that are recommended above are closed source, so they are safe for now, but no one knows what will happen in the future, so if you do not plan to invest large sums or for long periods, they are fairly good.you can also try -----> https://unstoppable.money/But if you want to store a long time, it is better for you to transfer your stablecoins into cash, given that stablecoins (USDT) may not be stable in the long term.

Pretty good for exchanging and storing TRX. Although, if you need a TRON wallet to connect to some services that support this network, it's better to use native TRON wallets, like TronLink.Both Trurst wallet and Atomic wallet are close source.I used Trust wallet but never used Atomic wallet. I did installed Atomic wallet on my computer but decide to uninstall it later.I did not want to install wallet softwares on my devices to use them. Metamask is my more favorite wallet than Trust wallet. I can use it directly on browsers.With wallet extensions on browsers, I did not use Chrome but chose Firefox. There is rumor that Chrome has loopholes and is compromised recent weeks.
